CatDescriptText: Mr. Willie Brackett, porter, 1803 Linton Street and Mrs. Ann Sanford, cook, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1960, pg. 37 with question: "Do you think the religious issue will play a major role in the selection of the Democratic party's nominee for the Presidency of the United States?" Mr. Willie Brackett's answer reads: "It might...However, it shouldn't hinder a real good candidate."  Mrs. Ann Sanford's answer reads: "Yes, I do.  I don't think the voters are ready to choose a Catholic President.  I think that the Bishop or Pope controls everything that a Catholic does, so therefore the country is not ready for it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Willie Brackett wearing hat and tweed jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Ann Sanford wearing suit with fur collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
